Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the unity of Democrats and Republicans in the Senate, as not all Republicans voted to keep the government open.
Understate: The claim may understate the division between Democrats and Republicans in the Senate, as no Republicans voted for the final passage of the bill mentioned by the President.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide specific details or evidence to back up the assertion that Democrats and Republicans in the Senate voted to keep the government open.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Senate vote to keep the government open was a responsible action, without considering alternative perspectives or potential consequences.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the Senate vote was not a unified bipartisan effort, as no Republicans voted for the final passage of the bill.
